duties_responsibilities.duty: Ensuring compliance with 21 CFR Part 210, 21 CFR Part 211, 21 CFR Part 820, 21 CFR Part 4, and Annex 1 requirements.
Tracking and maintaining internal and regulatory commitments for accuracy and timeliness.
Assisting in detection and solving of compliance errors in real time.
Developing and providing employee training on compliance policies and practices.
Acting as a trusted advisor to the site by providing guidance and facilitating resolution of compliance issues.
Participating in continuous improvement of department processes and inspection readiness.
Participating in internal audit activities, driving the closure of any observations, and tracking compliance KPIs.
Performing investigations into nonconformances using root cause analysis tools.

education_certification.credential: Master’s degree in relevant field with 2-3 years of experience, or Bachelor’s degree in a scientific discipline with 3-5 years of relevant experience. Previous experience in pharmaceutical manufacturing preferred.
